tuv.seg: Ireland's Parliament (Oireachtas) has the power to establish tribunals of inquiry to investigate certain matters of public importance
Tá an chumhacht ag an Oireachtas binsí fiosrúcháin a bhunú chun ceisteanna ar leith a iniúchadh a bhfuil tábhacht poiblí ag baint leo

If the Government considers that a particular issue of controversy or dispute is of such public importance that a public inquiry is necessary, it can propose legislation to set up a tribunal of inquiry

Má cheapann an Rialtas gur ceart fiosrúchán poiblí a dhéanamh ar cheist chonspóideach ar leith a bhfuil tábhacht poiblí ag baint léi, cuirfidh sé reachtaíocht faoi bhráid an Oireachtais chun binse fiosrúcháin a bhunú
These tribunals are not permanent tribunals. Instead, they are set up with powers to investigate specific matters
Ní binsí buan iad seo – cuirtear ar bun iad le cumhachtaí chun ceisteanna ar leith a iniúchadh
They are usually chaired by judges or senior lawyers
De ghnáth is iad breithimh nó dlíodóiri sinsearacha a bhíonn sa chathaoir
At the end of the investigation, the tribunal submits a report to the Oireachtas, which may contain recommendations
Ag deireadh an iniúchta, cuireann an binse tuairisc faoi bhráid an Oireachtais. D'fhéadfadh sé moltaí a chur leis
Some of the tribunals that have been set up in include:
Tá na binsí seo a leanas san áireamh le binsí a cuireadh ar bun le blianta beaga anuas:
• The Tribunal of Inquiry into the Beef Processing Industry, 1994
• An Binse Fiosrúcháin um Thionscal Próiseáil na Mairteolta 1994
This tribunal was set up to investigate alleged irregularities in the way the beef industry in Ireland was being run
Rinne an binse seo iniúchadh ar líomhaintí maidir le mírialtacht sa chaoi ina raibh tionscal na mairteola in Éirinn dhá reachtáil
• The Tribunal of Inquiry into the Blood Transfusion Service Board, 1997
• An Binse Fiosrúcháin um Bhord Seirbhísí Fuilaistriúcháin 1997
This tribunal was set up to investigate the infection of large numbers of people in the 1970s and 1980s with contaminated blood products
Rinne an binse seo iniúchadh ar ghalrú líon mór daoine le tairgí fola truaillithe i rith na 1970í agus na 1980í
• The Tribunal of Inquiry into Payments to Politicians (Dunnes Stores), 1997
• An Binse Fiosrúcháin um Íocaíochtaí do Pholaiteoirí (Siopaí Uí Dhuinn) 1997
This tribunal was set up to investigate the payment of moneys to politicians
Rinne an binse seo iniúchadh ar iocaíochtaí do pholaiteoirí
• The Mahon Tribunal (Formerly known as the 'Flood Tribunal')
• An Binse Fiosrúcháin Mahon (ar a dtugadh Binse Fiosrúcháin Flood)
This tribunal was set up to investigate payments to politicians in the context of planning decisions
Rinne an binse seo iniúchadh ar íocaíochtaí do pholaiteoirí i gcomhthéacs socruithe pleanála
This tribunal was set up to investigate into payments to politicians, including former Taoiseach Charles Haughey
Rinne an binse seo iniúchadh ar íocaíochtaí do pholaiteoirí, an t-iarthaoiseach Cathal Ó hEochaidh san áireamh
This tribunal was set up to inquire into the infection with HIV and Hepatitis C of persons with haemophilia
Rinne an binse seo iniúchadh ar ghalrú daoine a bhí haemifile acu le VEID agus Heipitíteas C
This tribunal was set up to examine claims of child abuse within the State's industrial schools
Rinne an binse seo iniúchadh ar líomhaintí maidir le mí-úsáid paistí laistigh de scoileanna ceardais an Stáit
This tribunal was set up to investigate complaints concerning some Gardaí of the Donegal division
Rinne an binse seo iniúchadh ar ghearáin maidir le Gardaí áirithe na ranna Dhún na nGall
To carry out the investigation, the tribunal is given certain powers, including the power to hold public or private hearings
Chun scrúdú a dhéanamh, tugtar cumhachtaí áirithe don bhinse, an chumhacht chun éisteachtaí poiblí nó príobháideacha a reachtáil san áireamh
The Oireachtas may decide that any tribunal that it sets up shall be invested with the powers set out in the Tribunals of Inquiry (Evidence) Act 1921 to 2004
D'fhéadfadh an tOireachtas cinneadh a dhéanamh go dtabharfar na cumhachtaí atá leagtha síos san Acht um Bhinsí Fiosrúcháin (Fianaise) 1921 go 1998 don bhinse
This Act provides that a tribunal can make orders to force witnesses to attend and give evidence
Tugann an tAcht seo cead don bhinse iachall a chur ar fhinnithe freastal ar an mbinse agus fianaise a thabhairt
It also allows the tribunal to apply to the High Court if a person refuses to give evidence or is in contempt of the tribunal
Tugann sé cead chomh maith don bhinse iarratas a dhéanamh chuig an Ardchúirt má dhiúltaíonn duine fianaise a thabhairt, nó má tá sé/sí i díspeagadh an bhinse
The High Court may order a witness to give evidence
D'fhéadfadh an Ardchúirt ordú a thabhairt d'fhinné fianaise a thabhairt

If he or she continues to fail to co-operate with the tribunal, the High Court may hold the witness in contempt of court and have the witness imprisoned until he or she has co-operated with the tribunal

Má leanann sé/sí ar aghaidh ag diúltú comhoibriú leis an mbinse, d'fhéadfadh an Ardchúirt é/í a chiontú i leith díspeagadh cúirte agus téarma príosúin a ghearradh air/uirthi go dtí go gcomhoibríonn sé/sí leis an mbinse
It is also a criminal offence to refuse to give evidence or to co-operate with a tribunal
Is coir í diúltú fianaise a thabhairt, nó diúltú comhoibriú le binse
If the tribunal considers that there is sufficient reason to do so, it can order any person to pay the costs of another person appearing before the tribunal or the costs of the tribunal itself
Má cheapann an binse go bhfuil fáth maith leis, d'fhéadfadh sé ordú a thabhairt d'aon duine costais fhreastail duine eile ar an mbinse a íoc, nó costais an bhinse féin
This may happen if a person fails to co-operate with the tribunal or gives false or misleading evidence
D'fhéadfadh sé sin tarlú má dhiúltaíonn duine comhoibriú leis an mbinse, nó má thugann siad fianaise bréagach, nó fianaise a d'fhéadfadh an binse a chur amú
At the end of the tribunal's investigation, it will submit a report to the Oireachtas setting out the findings it has made
Ag deireadh iniúctha an bhinse, cuirfidh sé tuairisc faoi bhráid an Oireachtais ag déanamh cur síos ar a thorthaí
In many cases, a tribunal of inquiry will also be given the power to make recommendations with a view to preventing the same problem happening again
I roinnt mhaith cásanna, tabharfar cead don bhinse fiosrúcháin moltaí a dhéanamh ionas nach dtarlóidh na fadhbanna céanna arís
These recommendations may include suggestions for law reform
D'fhéadfadh moltaí maidir le leasú dlí a bheith san áireamh
The tribunal's function is purely fact-finding and investigative
Ní dhéanann an binse ach obair thaighde agus mionscrúdú ar fhiricí
Although it may make recommendations, it does not make a binding judgement on the rights of individuals
Cé gur féidir leis moltaí a thabhairt, ní dhéanann sé breithiúnas daingean ar chearta daoine ar leith
It simply states, in its report, the results of its investigations and the findings of fact it has made
Déanann sé cur síos, ina thuairisc, ar thorthaí a scrúduithe agus an cinneadh atá déanta aige i dtaobh na bhfíricí
Any statement or admission made at a tribunal cannot be used in evidence against a person in criminal proceedings
Ní féidir ráiteas nó admháil ar bith a dhéanann duine os comhair binse a úsáid mar fhianaise ina (h)aghaidh i gcásanna coiriúla
However, sometimes the findings of tribunals can give rise to an investigation leading to independent criminal or civil proceedings
D'fhéadfadh scrúdú a éirí as torthaí binsí áfach, a bheadh cásanna neamspleácha coiriúla nó sibhialtachta ag éirí as
This means that strict procedures are usually applied in the course of the tribunals
Ciallaíonn sé sin go gcuirtear modh oibre géar i bhfeidhm i rith binsí, de ghnáth
Interested parties usually have legal representation, including a solicitor, a junior counsel and a senior counsel
Bíonn ionadaíocht dlíthiúil de ghnáth ag páirtithe a bhfuil baint acu leis, aturnae, abhcóide sóisir agus sinsir san áireamh
Witnesses are usually cross-examined
Déantar finnithe a chroscheistiú de ghnáth
Law Reform Commission report
Tuarascáil an Choimisiúin um Athchóiriú an Dlí
In May 2005, the Law Reform Commission published a Report on Public Inquiries Including Tribunals of Inquiry (pdf)
I mBealtaine 2005, d’fhoilsigh an Coimisiún um Athchóiriú an Dlí Tuarascáil um Fhiosrúcháin Phoiblí lena n-áirítear Binsí Fiosrúcháin (pdf)
This Report followed on from a Consultation Paper originally published by the Law Reform Commission in 2003
Ba thoradh í an tuarascáil seo ar Phaipéar Comhairliúcháin a d’fhoilsigh an Coimisiún um Athchóiriú an Dlí i 2003
The Report came in the wake of the establishment of numerous tribunals
Foilsíodh an Tuarascáil i gcomhthéacs na mbinsí iomadúla a cuireadh ar bun in Éirinn le blianta beaga anuas
These tribunals have examined various matters, including major disasters involving loss of life, and allegations of wrongdoing in land development and the planning process
D’fhiosraigh na binsí seo réimse ábhar éagsúil, lenar áiríodh tubaistí ollmhóra inar maraíodh daoine, líomhaintí faoi mhí-iompar i bhforbairt talún agus sa phróiseas pleanála féin fiú

The Report's recommendations include procedural changes concerning the selection of an appropriate type of inquiry, drafting appropriate terms of reference, the rights of individuals and organisations to be heard and represented and the awarding of legal costs

Molann an tuarascáil athruithe sa nós imeachta freisin i dtaca le roghnú an chineáil fhiosrúcháin chuí, dréachtú téarmaí tagartha cuí, cearta dhaoine aonair agus eagras lena n-éisteacht agus lena n-ionadaíocht agus bronnadh costas dlí
Tribunals of inquiry and costs
Binsí fiosrúcháin agus costais
The cost of tribunals of inquiry, including the cost of legal representation of all interested parties, is usually paid by the State
De ghnáth, íocann an stát as costais bhinsí fiosrúcháin, costas ionadaíochta gach páirtí a bhfuil baint acu leis san áireamh
Significant costs have arisen in recent years with regard to tribunals
Bhain costais shuntasacha le binsí fiosruithe le blianta beaga anuas
The Comptroller and Auditor General published a Special Report into Tribunals of Inquiry (pdf) in December 2008
D'fhoilsigh an tArd Reachtaire Cuntas agus Ciste Tuarascáil Speisialta faoi Bhinsí Fiosrúcháin (pdf) i Nollaig 2008
The report gives an estimate of the costs involved in the more recent Mahon, Moriarty and Morris tribunals
Tugann an tuarascáil costais measta sna binsí Mahon, Moriarty agus Morris
The Tribunals of Inquiry Bill 2005 (pdf) aims to consolidate and modernise the law regarding Tribunals of Inquiry
Tá an Bille um Binsí Fiosrúcháin 2005 (pdf) dírithe ar a chomhdhlúthódh agus a d’athnuafadh an dlí maidir le Binsí Fiosrúcháin
The Bill contains provisons which:
Tá iad seo a leanas príomhghnéithe dhréachtscéim an Bhille:
• Clarify the process for setting and amending terms of reference of a tribunal
• Soiléiriú ar an bpróiseas chun téarmaí tagartha na mbinsí a bhunú agus a leasú;
• Require a tribunal, within three months of its establishment, to produce a statement of estimated costs and duration of the tribunal
• Laistigh de thrí mhí ó dháta a bhunaithe, beidh ar an mbinse ráiteas a sholáthar le meastacháin ann ar a chostas agus a achar feidhmiúcháin
This statement must be subsequently amended after significant developments
Leasófar an ráiteas seo más gá i bhfianaise forbairtí suntasacha;
• Enable the Government for stated reasons and following a resolution of both Houses of the Oireachtas to dissolve a tribunal
• Beidh sé de chumhacht ag an Rialtas binse a dhíscaoileadh ach na cúiseanna a fhógairt agus rún chuige sin a fháil ó dhá theach an Oireachtais;
• Governing the taking of evidence, including a provision to end the costly practice of orally reading-in of evidence already available in written form and not disputed

• Socruithe maidir le soláthar fianaise, lena n-áirítear foráil chun deireadh a chur leis an gcleachtas costasach faoina léitear amach fianaise atá ar fáil cheana féin i bhfoirm scríofa agus nach bhfuil faoi dhíospóid;
• Clarify the situation with regard to the granting of legal representation before a tribunal
• Soiléiriú ar na cúinsí maidir le ceadú ionadaíochta dlíthiúla os comhair binse;
• Enable the responsible Minister will be able to request an interim report on the general progress of an inquiry, or of a particular aspect of an inquiry, from the tribunal
• Beidh sé de chumhacht ag an aAire cuí tuarascáil eatramhach a éileamh ón mbinse ar dhul chun cinn ginearálta an fhiosrúcháin nó gné ar leith de;
• Allow tribunal reports to be admissible in civil cases
• Glacfar le tuarascálacha binse i gcásanna dlí sibhialta
This section provides that the facts in a report or the opinions expressed therein are uncontested
Forálann an mhír seo gur fianaise prima facie (.i
• Require the Minister for Justice and Equality, with the consent of the Minister for Finance, to make regulations which will set out maximum amounts of legal fees recoverable from the State
de réir cosúlachta) iad na fíricí i dtuarascáil éigin nó na tuairimí a nochtar inti, mura gcruthaítear a mhalairt;
• Require the Taxing Master of the High Court, when adjudicating on applications for costs in respect of third parties, not to exceed the amounts set out in the regulations
• Beidh ar an Aire Cirt, Comhionannais agus Comhionannais le toiliú an tAire Airgeadais rialacháin a dhéanamh a leagann síos uasmhéideanna costas inghnóthaithe ón Stát
